5.01     TERM.  The  term  ("Term")  of  this Agreement shall be for one hundred
eighty  days  (180)  from  the  date set forth below unless Network 1 or Visa or
MasterCard  or Harris Bank doesn't approve Affiliate's ISO application, in which
case,  the  Term  will  be  3 years. This Agreement will automatically renew for
successive  one-year  terms  unless  terminated by either party by providing the
other  with  30  days  written notice that this Agreement will not be renewed or
Affiliate  enters  into  a  Processing  agreement  with  Network  1  and  an ISO
Sponsorship  agreement  with  Harris  Bank  in  which  case  this Agreement will
automatically  terminate  concurrent  with  the  execution  of  such agreements.
perturbation.changed_text:
5.01     TERM.  The  term  ("Term")  of  this Agreement shall be for one hundred
eighty  days  (180)  from  the  date set forth below unless Network 1 or Visa or
MasterCard  or Harris Bank doesn't approve Affiliate's ISO application, in which
case,  the  Term  will  be  3 years. This Agreement will automatically renew for
successive  one-year  terms  unless  terminated by either party by providing the
other  with  10  days  written notice that this Agreement will not be renewed or
Affiliate  enters  into  a  Processing  agreement  with  Network  1  and  an ISO
Sponsorship  agreement  with  Harris  Bank  in  which  case  this Agreement will
automatically  terminate  concurrent  with  the  execution  of  such agreements.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the written notice period for non-renewal from 30 days to 10 days conflicts with standard contract law principles and potentially state laws that often require reasonable notice periods, particularly in agreements with automatic renewal clauses. 10 days is likely too short a period to be considered 'reasonable'.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General Contract Law Principles, potential state laws regarding reasonable notice periods for contract renewal.

perturbation.original_text:
A.     By  either  party  as  a  result of default by the other party under this
Agreement  and failure to cure said default within thirty (30) days after notice
of  said  default  is  given.
perturbation.changed_text:
A.     By  either  party  as  a  result of default by the other party under this
Agreement  and failure to cure said default within five (5) days after notice
of  said  default  is  given.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the cure period for a default from 30 days to 5 days is inconsistent with typical commercial reasonableness standards. Many jurisdictions would consider 5 days insufficient, especially for complex defaults, and would deem it unconscionable. This change significantly favors one party and undermines fairness.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General Contract Law Principles, Unconscionability Doctrine

perturbation.original_text:
5.03     EFFECT  OF  TERMINATION.  Upon termination of this Agreement, except in
the  event  of  termination  due  to an uncured default by Affiliate pursuant to
Section  5.02  [TERMINATION]A, Network 1 shall continue to pay to the Affiliate the Affiliate's
Fee  described  in  Section  3.01  [AMOUNT]B for so long as Network 1 continues to process
transactions  of the Merchants in accordance with Schedule B attached hereto and
Affiliate  continues  to maintain the merchant accounts, provided, however, that
no such Affiliate's Fees shall be earned or paid for any calendar month in which
the  Affiliate's  Fee  does not exceed $500.  Upon termination due to an uncured
default  by  Affiliate,  or  termination for cause pursuant to Section 5.02  [TERMINATION]D all
Affiliates  fees  shall  cease  to  be  accrued  and  paid  immediately upon the
occurrence  of  said  event.
perturbation.changed_text:
5.03     EFFECT  OF  TERMINATION.  Upon termination of this Agreement, except in
the  event  of  termination  due  to an uncured default by Affiliate pursuant to
Section  5.02  [TERMINATION]A, Network 1 shall continue to pay to the Affiliate the Affiliate's
Fee  described  in  Section  3.01  [AMOUNT]B for so long as Network 1 continues to process
transactions  of the Merchants in accordance with Schedule B attached hereto and
Affiliate  continues  to maintain the merchant accounts, provided, however, that
no such Affiliate's Fees shall be earned or paid for any calendar month in which
the  Affiliate's  Fee  does not exceed $500. Upon termination of this agreement Network 1 will only accrue 50% of Affiliate fees.
perturbation.explanation: By dictating a flat accrual of '50%' after termination, the text now fails to provide for residual payments in a reasonable way to Affiliate. If the affiliate's fee should have been something higher, there's no mechanism for the business to still get paid.
